ColorShapeLinks AI
An AI competition for the IEEE Conference on Games
ThinkerManager.cs
1 
9 using System;
10 using System.Linq;
11 using System.Collections.Generic;
12 
13 namespace ColorShapeLinks.Common.AI
14 {
19  public class ThinkerManager
20  {
21  // Unique instance of this class, instantiated lazily
22  private static readonly Lazy<ThinkerManager> instance =
23  new Lazy<ThinkerManager>(() => new ThinkerManager());
24 
25  // Known thinkers
26  private readonly IDictionary<string, Type> thinkerTable;
27 
32  public static ThinkerManager Instance => instance.Value;
33 
38  public string[] ThinkerNames => thinkerTable.Keys.ToArray();
39 
50  public bool IsKnown(string thinkerFQN) =>
51  thinkerTable.ContainsKey(thinkerFQN);
52 
62  public Type GetTypeFromFQN(string thinkerFQN) =>
63  thinkerTable[thinkerFQN];
64 
65  // Private constructor
66  private ThinkerManager()
67  {
68  // Get a reference to the AbstractThinker type
69  Type type = typeof(AbstractThinker);
70 
71  // Get known thinkers, i.e. thinkers which extend AbstractThinker,
72  // are not abstract and have an empty constructor
73  thinkerTable = AppDomain.CurrentDomain.GetAssemblies()
74  .SelectMany(a => a.GetTypes())
75  .Where(t => type.IsAssignableFrom(t)
76  && !t.IsAbstract
77  && t.GetConstructor(Type.EmptyTypes) != null)
78  .ToDictionary(t => t.FullName, t => t);
79  }
80  }
81 }
ColorShapeLinks.Common.AI.AbstractThinker
The actual AI code of specific AIs should be placed in classes which extend this class.
